30s and we had agreed on kids and waiting years to start having kids it was closer to years we now have 10 month old we had said we would try for baby right after year noticed he has been in mood lately and yesterday agreed that if he told me would just listen and not respond that was his request knowing would like to hear what he had to say so he told me he does want another child because he does want to be an old dad because he does want to be in poor health when the kid is in their 30s because he would never meet his grandkids just like his dad never met our son listened and asked if we could have discussion on this next year because also not ready for baby right now ve got ta lose the baby weight or ll have an at risk pregnancy plus had promised just to listen and not discuss but you guys heartbroken we had even agreed that if baby was boy we would try 3rd time for girl now the thought of having an only child makes me so sad realize we are blessed to even have this little guy so please do think ungrateful it is just such change in what had always envisioned as my family any thoughts comments suggestions could this just be mid life crisis thing where his fears of not being around for his kids change later on he is in excellent shape amp health oh man after my mom died well before met my now husband and had our first kid went off the rails for quite some time it was just such shock to me that nothing made any sense for really long time so could see where your husband might be having such grief that he truly feels he does want any more kids it control thing think evidenced by his references to his health in his 70s etc why set myself and my family up for pain like experiencing now midlife crisis mortality is big factor as well is he experiencing depression right now would he be open to grief counseling really believe that can help but not everyone feels that way think you did the right thing tabling the discussion for now hopefully as time goes by and healing happens he will rethink his position on more kids you did the right thing you do need to make final decisions right now ever heard the saying do quit on bad day he probably just grieving give him time and space for now definitely do agree to no more kids but tell him you hear what he saying and that you do have to discuss it for awhile later down the road he might feel differently it just does seem like the appropriate time to fight that battle give him time if he had never wanted more than one kid it would be different but this is recent change of mind that could change back know you are asking for help with your husband but you sound like me three months ago on reddit https www reddit com oneanddone comments 3l1nqq accepting that were one and done finally honestly grieved for few days for the life that thought wanted was surprised that became ok with this after few weeks of being upset of course this might not be as ok for you as it became for me still feel lingering guilt over not having sibling for my daughter edit link fixing agree with the posted comments great job on asking for renewed discussion for next year grief is complicated process and everyone goes through it differently if he is willing to do some counseling great if not give him some time there is any need to pursue it further at this point until you are seeing that you are starting to be ready thank you this was such an encouragement if you bring it up to him again right now it might just upset him and strengthen his resolve would say anything about it to anyone for few months when someone asks and your husband is in ear shot just say not right now but we ve agreed to re open the discussion in the future then after some time has passed and some wounds have healed maybe ask him to listen to you without responding the way you did with him then open the discussion again when you are both not so emotional hang in there op be patient he may change his mind in few months was in discussion about this same topic in facebook group week ago several at least moms posted pictures of their we re not having any more kids kids did either of you grow up as an only child did and it was lonely also you already have one child if they re only years apart what difference will having two instead of one make on his being an old dad besides letting everything have chance to settle please consider grief counseling for your husband if he does seem to be able to return to state of normalcy should things resolve where he really would like to have another baby adoption or mentoring may be other options am sorry your family is going through rough patch but little by little you all will feel better am in the opposite of your shoes my husband and had always planned on two kids but as sit here pregnant 39+5 the more think about it the more only want one my husband and talked about it laid out my reasons for feeling this way he acknowledged my feelings and reiterated why he does agree but we ultimately decided to shelf the discussion until the middle of next year because there no reason to push ourselves to resolution right now because neither of us is ready to do anything about that choice just yet my advice to you would be to contemplate both options and think about the pros and cons so when next year comes around you re ready to discuss it without the strong emotional response you re feeling now it could be this is part of his grief cycle but it could be choice that been brewing for while and he just now bringing it up only time will tell good luck momma you did the right thing listening and saying maybe it be best to talk about it later am 31 and even at that age wonder about ever getting the chance to meet my grandchildren but when the topic is discussed again with your husband mention to him that having children is not just about seeing your grandchildren it also just knowing that you are leaving grandchildren behind to live on and keep your memory alive my grandmother once sat in room full of 50 something people and said wow you are all here because of me and it was true few years later she passed away but ll remember that moment forever having children more than one is also about having sibling for your one child to grow up with to share memories with it about them one day being an aunt or uncle and getting to experience how amazing it is to see their brother or sister have their first child have nephew or niece to spoil and love if your husband only has one child they will never get to experience that it about the nieces and nephews having cousins to get together with at family gatherings to grow up with and share more memories so it not just about him getting to see his grandchildren also he is grieving right now and very sad that his born death is never easy he is grieving in year he might also not feel the same about it but if he does remind him of all the other reasons why you should have second child thank you this makes sense this post is so close to the anniversary of your father passing think that why decided to answer it hit close to home and is still fresh in some ways for me gt what were things that would upset me the times when she would point out cute babies or baby clothes at the store though knew she was doing it to hurt me was angry over my dad passing and unfortunately she would get the brunt of it by way of my refusal to talk was **adamant** about never having child again but was thrilled with talking about it either did tell her was not ready to talk about it if she started hinting at the topic later on typically would just change the subject when it came up to which she would drop it for while usually month or so gt what made me marvel at the goodness of my wife what moved me the fact that she never gave up on me she reminded me she was there whenever was ready to talk she italian so patience and calm demeanors are not her strong suit she used to facing problems head on and calling people on their shit she knew however was already depressed because hated my job where worked for years before my dad died rather than face my grief threw myself into work and emotionally suppressed everything for year would talk to anyone if it had to do with my emotional well being shut my wife out and barely played with our daughter except out of obligation she has the patience of saint because anyone else would have left me and would have been right to do so as time went by the pressure from my job increased and so my depression became worse it got to the point was working 60 75 hours week so barely saw my family she still never gave up she still made sure we were taken care of and reminded me that she was still there whenever was ready to talk 13 months after my dad died february 2015 lost my job it was the best thing that ever happened to both of us the free time forced me to grieve the loss ignored for so long it forced me to realize how much neglected my family and it forced me to finally realize my wife has been trying to help all along you can do it there are ton of awesome fitness subreddits too if you need advice or encouragement and support ugh now my husband is saying this is the last one anytime the baby does something he doesnt like its like little dagger in my heart each time do know why never thought of looking up fitness subreddit totally doing that today your wife is amazing know have been as patient as your wife how old was your daughter when all of this happened my husband has also suppressed his feelings for just as long as our son has been alive he just seems miserable and unhappy when he is home there so much to be happy for and ve encouraged him to take time off if that what he needs he has the vacation time to do it but he does so just do know how to help him and know he does want my help either need to learn from your wife on this one she is saint goodness that hard do you think he means it yes think so when think about the short term yes it would be nice to be done but they are little for such short time would like to have nice family gatherings and lots of grandkids so this is why would like third child would go an extra year of sleepless nights to get this sorry bet it hurts every time it mentioned probably break down in tears every single time if were you are you planning on future sit down like serious discussion where final decision is made yeah think when baby turns one the decision will be made am not 100 sure either but the baby crying has nothing to do with me being on the fence about it know it goes by so fast our first is almost my daughter was two when my dad passed away which made it that much harder for me because know she wo remember much if anything of him when she gets older we ve got picture of my dad holding her as baby in her bedroom and she still talks about him from time to time but it gets fewer and further between as time passes yeah feel like it an issue that if it not time sensitive is going to be better to approach if the pressure is off bit if you force someone to give you an answer straight away while they re in the middle of feeling negatively about it then the likelihood of everything being resolved to everyone satisfaction is great hope he calms down soon and you both feel ready to take the plunge good luck thank you for the encouragement much appreciated our son was weeks old when my fil passed he only saw our son through facetime can try putting myself in my husband shoes adore my dad amp thankfully still have him around if my son did get to know him absolutely be sad about it and do know how would react because ve never lost parent so do pretend to know the depth of the pain he is going through just am at loss because he wo talk to me or anyone about it he wo go to counseling he bottles it up and just lashes out in anger do think ve ever felt more lonely and just unhappy and know this is about me it about us amp our family so do mean to come across as like poor me it just really sucks right now and really any advice you have for me as wife or things can suggest for him are appreciated thanks so much for opening up sure it was at all easy to go back amp forth on such sensitive topic thank you thank you thank you that good glad to see you guys are going to revisit this later on my wife corrected me my daughter kisses my father portrait more than realize and still talks about him but more frequently when not around so think the kid realizes it still hurts me sometimes showed my wife our chats and she says one wife to another gt you need to find something to throw yourself into that will let you separate yourself from it all once in while go on girl night out read book watch movie anything that helps you distance yourself from time to time it does solve the issue but it does help give you time to focus on you which is just as important rather than put all of your energy and focus on your husband most importantly find someone you can confide in started spending more time with my best friend and talking to her more frequently during this period which helped me lot as for me just want to address one part of your last comment gt and know this is about me it about us amp our family so do mean to come across as like poor me you have come across that way at all but do ever let yourself think you re any less important because your husband is going through all of this that was the mistake made kept my wife and my daughter at arm length for little over year because did want to grieve or admit to my wife needed help was trying to tough it out when really just needed to hold my family and be with them it going to take time for him to grieve but do give up and do let him put you or your son on an emotional back burner either thank you and your wife such great perspectives from each side really appreciate it here to patience and sensitivity and hoping my husband comes around to the idea of getting some counseling for what he is going through thank you hopefully next year will post better news
